step.cmd: Open the Data Collections page, by clicking the Data Collections icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The Data Collections page opens showing all defined data categories.

step.cmd: Click the New Data Collection button.
step.info: The New Data Collection screen opens with only the Data Policy tab showing.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. A name for the data collection. Numbers, letters, spaces, hyphens, and the underscore character are supported.
chdesc.note: Once you save a data collection, the name cannot be edited. To change the name, you must delete the whole data collection and reconfigure it with the new name.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. The data category of the data collection. Choose from the drop-down list of data categories.

p.xref: How do I define data categories?

chdesc.p: Mandatory. The individual responsible overall for data stored in . Only users with a role of are eligible. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.

Mandatory. The individual responsible for defining the organization's governance policy and for approving access policies. Only users with a role of are eligible. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.
Mandatory. The individual responsible for approving dataset requests involving this data collection. Only users with a role of are eligible. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.

Optional. The data visibility (privacy tag) to be associated with this data collection. Choose from the list of configured data visibilities. You can select multiple items by holding down the Shift key. By default, no data visibility is applied.
Optional. The access policy for enforcing rightful access to data from this data collection. Choose from the list of configured access policies. By default, no access policy is applied.
Optional. The kinds of document expected from this data collection. Examples are Microsoft Word, Excel, or JSON.
Optional. A brief description of the kinds of documents expected from this data collection.
Optional. Any additional notes for the data collection.

step.cmd: Upload the data sharing agreement. The data sharing agreement records permission for this data to reside on .
step.info: Click the Choose File button and navigate to the document in your local file system. Double-click the file to select it. The system uploads the document.Specify the period during which this data sharing agreement is in effect. The format for the start and end dates is mm-dd-yyyy.

step.cmd: Specify the retention rules. These rules are used to determine how long each item from this data collection can remain in the system.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. Specifies when data should be erased from the system. Supported values are as follows:

ul.li: Retain for a time period. Keeps the data for the period specified. Specify some number of minutes, hours, days, weeks or years.
Delete after time period. Erases the data after the specified time period. Specify some number of minutes, hours, days, weeks or years.
Do not delete. The data is never deleted.

Delete oldest data once capacity is reached. Deletes data items with the oldest timestamp after the specified capacity is reached. Specify the capacity as some number of Kilobytes, Megabytes, or Gigabytes.

chdesc.p: Optional. Maintains version control over data. Check to enable version control; uncheck to disable version control. By default, version control is disabled.

step.cmd: Click the Save button to save the data policy. When the data policy has been successfully saved, the Data Processing Function and Ingest Data tabs appear as available on the screen.
